author: Linbie Pham
title: Slow Cooker Brisket Chili
ingredients: 2 lbs beef brisket, trimmed and cut into large chunks
1 (15 oz) can black beans, drained and rinsed
1 (15 oz) can red kidney beans, drained and rinsed
Optional toppings: shredded cheddar cheese, sour cream, chopped cilantro
instructions_list: Dice the onion, mince the garlic, and chop both bell peppers.
Sear brisket chunks in a hot pan with a bit of oil until browned on all sides (about 5–6 minutes).

Add the cooked brisket (cut into square chunks), diced onions, minced garlic, diced red and green bell peppers, both cans of beans (drained and rinsed), the crushed tomatoes, tomato paste, beef broth, and brown sugar. Sprinkle in the chili powder, smoked paprika, cumin, oregano, salt, and pepper. Give it a gentle stir to combine everything evenly.
Cover and cook on low for 8 hours or high for 4 hours until brisket is super tender and shreds easily.
Use two forks to shred the brisket right in the slow cooker and stir everything together.

Ladle the chili into bowls and add your favorite toppings. Try shredded cheddar cheese, a dollop of sour cream, and fresh chopped cilantro. Serve with cornbread, tortilla chips, or a slice of crusty bread.
description: This Slow Cooker Brisket Chili is one of those set-it-and-forget-it meals that feels like a warm hug in a bowl. You toss everything in, let it cook low and slow, and by dinnertime you’ve got rich, smoky, beefy chili that tastes like you worked all day – when really, your slow cooker did all the heavy lifting. Great for game day, chilly nights, or feeding a hungry crowd. Kids love it, grown-ups fight over seconds. It’s that good.
